summary: The Larry Henderson Act amends Title 18 of the United States Code to impose mandatory minimum penalties, specifically a 20-year prison sentence, for assaulting officers and employees of the United States. It replaces the existing penalties outlined in Section 111(a) of Title 18. This act supersedes any state laws that relate to assaulting federal employees while on duty. It also makes technical amendments to update related sections of the code and specifies the Act's applicability to offenses committed on or after its enactment.
